get.description: Retrieves the namespace access points available for the authenticated user.

parameters.description: Protocol versions that are supported for the current namespace access server.
parameters.name: versions

put.description: Creates a namespace access point in the file system. Only root users can create or change namespace access points.

parameters.description: Access point name.
parameters.name: AccessPointName

parameters.description: Access point parameters model.
parameters.name: AccessPoint

delete.description: Deletes a namespace access point. Only root users can delete namespace access points.

parameters.description: Access point name.
parameters.name: AccessPointName

get.description: Retrieves the access control list for a namespace object.

parameters.description: Namespace path relative to /.
parameters.name: NamespacePath

parameters.description: Show access control lists.
parameters.name: acl

parameters.description: Indicates that the operation is on the access point instead of the store path.
parameters.name: nsaccess

put.description: Sets the access control list for a namespace.

parameters.description: Namespace path relative to /.
parameters.name: NamespacePath

parameters.description: Update access control lists.
parameters.name: acl

parameters.description: Indicates that the operation is on the access point instead of the store path.
parameters.name: nsaccess

parameters.description: Namespace ACL parameters model.
parameters.name: NamespaceAcl

get.description: Retrieves a list of files and subdirectories from a directory.

parameters.description: Directory path relative to /.
parameters.name: DirectoryPath

parameters.description: Specifies which object attributes are displayed.
parameters.name: detail

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of objects to send to the client.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Specifies a token to return in the JSON result to indicate when there is a next page.
parameters.name: resume

parameters.description: Specifies one or more attributes to sort on the directory entries.
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Specifies the sort direction. This value can be either ascending (ASC) or descending (DESC).
parameters.name: dir

parameters.description: Specifies the object type to return, which can be one of the following values: container, object, pipe, character_device, block_device, symbolic_link, socket, or whiteout_file.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Specifies if hidden objects are returned.
parameters.name: hidden

head.description: Retrieves the attribute information for a specified directory without transferring the contents of the directory.

parameters.description: Directory path relative to /.
parameters.name: DirectoryPath

parameters.description: Returns only files that were modified since the specified time. If no files were modified since this time, a 304 message is returned.
parameters.name: If-Modified-Since

parameters.description: Returns only files that were not modified since the specified time. If there are no unmodified files since this time, a 412 message is returned to indicate that the precondition failed.
parameters.name: If-Unmodified-Since

put.description: Creates a directory with a specified path.

parameters.description: Directory path relative to /.
parameters.name: DirectoryPath

parameters.description: Specifies the resource type.
parameters.name: x-isi-ifs-target-type

parameters.description: Specifies a pre-defined ACL value or POSIX mode with a string in octal string format.
parameters.name: x-isi-ifs-access-control

parameters.description: Specifies a pre-defined ACL value or POSIX mode with a string.
parameters.name: x-isi-ifs-node-pool-name

parameters.description: Specifies the OneFS node pool name.
parameters.name: recursive

parameters.description: Deletes and replaces the existing user attributes and ACLs of the directory with user-specified attributes and ACLS from the header, when set to true.
parameters.name: overwrite

post.description: Moves a directory from an existing source to a new destination path.

parameters.description: Directory path relative to /.
parameters.name: DirectoryPath

parameters.description: Specifies the full path for the destination directory.
parameters.name: x-isi-ifs-set-location

delete.description: Deletes the directory at the specified path.

parameters.description: Directory path relative to /.
parameters.name: DirectoryPath

parameters.description: Deletes directories recursively, when set to true.
parameters.name: recursive

get.description: Retrieves the attribute information for a specified directory with the metadata query argument.

parameters.description: Directory path relative to /.
parameters.name: DirectoryMetadataPath

parameters.description: Show directory metadata.
parameters.name: metadata

put.description: Sets attributes on a specified directory with the metadata query argument.

parameters.description: Directory path relative to /.
parameters.name: DirectoryMetadataPath

parameters.description: Set directory metadata.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.description: Directory metadata parameters model.
parameters.name: DirectoryMetadata

put.description: Recursively copies a directory to a specified destination path. Symbolic links are copied as regular files.

parameters.description: Directory copy destination relative to /.
parameters.name: DirectoryCopyTarget

parameters.description: Specifies the full path to the source directory.
parameters.name: x-isi-ifs-copy-source

parameters.description: Deletes and replaces the existing user attributes and ACLs of the directory with user-specified attributes and ACLS from the header, when set to true.
parameters.name: overwrite

parameters.description: Specifies if the contents of a directory should be merged with an existing directory with the same name.
parameters.name: merge

parameters.description: Specifies whether to continue the copy operation on remaining objects when there is a conflict or error.
parameters.name: continue

get.description: Retrieves the contents of a file from a specified path. Note that file streaming is not supported.

parameters.description: File path relative to /.
parameters.name: FilePath

parameters.description: Returns the specified range bytes of an object.
parameters.name: Range

parameters.description: Returns only files that were modified since the specified time. If no files were modified since this time, a 304 message is returned.
parameters.name: If-Modified-Since

parameters.description: Returns only files that were not modified since the specified time. If there are no unmodified files since this time, a 412 message is returned to indicate that the precondition failed.
parameters.name: If-Unmodified-Since

head.description: Retrieves the attribute information for a specified file.

parameters.description: File path relative to /.
parameters.name: FilePath

parameters.description: Returns only files that were modified since the specified time. If no files were modified since this time, a 304 message is returned.
parameters.name: If-Modified-Since

parameters.description: Returns only files that were not modified since the specified time. If there are no unmodified files since this time, a 412 message is returned to indicate that the precondition failed.
parameters.name: If-Unmodified-Since

put.description: Creates a file object with a given path. Note that file streaming is not supported.

parameters.description: File path relative to /.
parameters.name: FilePath

parameters.description: Specifies the resource type.
parameters.name: x-isi-ifs-target-type

parameters.description: Specifies a pre-defined ACL value or POSIX mode with a string in octal string format.
parameters.name: x-isi-ifs-access-control

parameters.description: Specifies the content encoding that was applied to the object content, so that decoding can be applied when retrieving the content.
parameters.name: Content-Encoding

parameters.description: Specifies a standard MIME-type description of the content format.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: Deletes and replaces the existing user attributes and ACLs of the directory with user-specified attributes and ACLS from the header, when set to true.
parameters.name: overwrite

parameters.description: The contents of the file object.
parameters.name: FileContents

post.description: Moves a file to a destination path that does not yet exist.

parameters.description: File path relative to /.
parameters.name: FilePath

parameters.description: Specifies the full path for the destination file.
parameters.name: x-isi-ifs-set-location

parameters.description: File path relative to /.
parameters.name: FilePath

put.description: Copies a file to the specified destination path.

parameters.description: File copy destination relative to /.
parameters.name: FileCopyTarget

parameters.description: Specifies the full path to the source file.
parameters.name: x-isi-ifs-copy-source

parameters.description: You must set this parameter to true in order to clone a file.
parameters.name: clone

parameters.description: Specifies a snapshot name to clone the file from.
parameters.name: snapshot

parameters.description: Specifies if an existing file should be overwritten by a new file with the same name.
parameters.name: overwrite

get.description: Retrieves the attribute information for a specified file with the metadata query argument.

parameters.description: File path relative to /.
parameters.name: FileMetadataPath

parameters.description: Show file metadata.
parameters.name: metadata

put.description: Sets attributes on a specified file with the metadata query argument through the JSON body.

parameters.description: File path relative to /.
parameters.name: FileMetadataPath

parameters.description: Set file metadata.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.description: File metadata parameters model.
parameters.name: FileMetadata

post.description: Query objects by system-defined and user-defined attributes in a directory.

parameters.description: Directory path relative to /.
parameters.name: QueryPath

parameters.description: Enable directory query.
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of objects to send to the client. You can set the value to a negative number to retrieve all objects.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Specifies which object attributes are displayed. If the detail parameter is excluded, only the name of the object is returned.
parameters.name: detail

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum directory level depth to search for objects.
parameters.name: max-depth

parameters.description: Directory query parameters model.
parameters.name: DirectoryQuery

get.description: Retrieves the WORM retention date and committed state of the file.

parameters.description: Write once read many file path relative to /.
parameters.name: WormFilePath

parameters.description: View WORM properties
parameters.name: worm

put.description: Sets the retention period and commits a file in a SmartLock directory.

parameters.description: Write once read many file path relative to /.
parameters.name: WormFilePath

parameters.description: View WORM properties
parameters.name: worm

parameters.description: WORM parameters model.
parameters.name: WormProperties
